intro: Physena madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar physena, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
